Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "August 2023 Microsoft 365 update" (#1531) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
### Added

- `DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office.PowerPoint.Y2023.M02.Main` namespace
- `DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office.PowerPoint.Y2022.M03.Main` namespace
- `DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office.SpreadSheetML.Y2021.ExtLinks2021` namespace

### Breaking Changes

- `Model3D` now represents the modified xml element tag name `am3d.model3d` (Previously `am3d.model3D`)
- Removed `DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office.SpreadSheetML.Y2022.PivotRichData.PivotCacheHasRichValuePivotCacheRichInfo`
- Removed `DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office.SpreadSheetML.Y2022.PivotRichData.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Open XML SDK v3: struct IdPartPair" (#1520) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
It would be nice to mention all v3-breaking changes in the release notes clearly.

**Screenshots**
Bug with the fix.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/Open-XML-SDK/assets/1197905/d00a99ed-b473-45c0-9781-635d8d883864)

**To Reproduce**
`IdPartPait` has been converted from class to struct in v3 (most likely for performance reasons).

This change silently broke code that worked fine before and checked the value with `null`.
After the upgrade, the code compile without errors, but some branches became unreachable and app/library no longer works as expected.

**Observed behavior**
No release notes yet ;)

**Expected behavior**
Mention such cases inside the Breaking Changes section in released notes.

**Additional context**
I believe that it will be helpful for apps and library authors who decide to migrate to v3.
Found [during migrating](https://github.com/sergey-tihon/Clippit/pull/63) my fork of PowerTools to SDK v3

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Microsoft Publisher support?" (#1529) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello,

I'm trying to get rid of some old Office Interopt code and I'm looking for something to manipulate publisher documents. Is this something Open-XML-SDK supports as well?
